etymologies: early 17th century (in the sense ‘assistant, helper’): from Latin adjutant- ‘being of service to’, from adjutare, frequentative of adjuvare ‘assist’ (see adjuvant)

definitions: a military officer who acts as an administrative assistant to a senior officer

examples.text: he eventually became adjutant to the commander of the tactical air force

shortDefinitions: military officer who acts as administrative assistant

examples.text: Hoare was his adjutant in all the talks with the government

definitions: a large black-and-white stork with a massive bill and a bare head and neck, found in India and Southeast Asia.

notes.text: Genus Leptoptilos, family Ciconiidae: two species

shortDefinitions: large black-and-white stork with massive bill
